profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
-	Creation of a consortium including the Government of Afghanistan, UN agencies and CSOs to develop a system of beneficiary selection to measure vulnerability and orient interventions to provide housing assistance to returnees, IDPs and deportees 
-	Design of data collection tools to elucidate living conditions and inform programming in informal settlements in urban Afghanistan
-	Contribute to the reform of the legal and policy framework surrounding allocation of land to the displaced in Afghanistan 
-	Utilization of collected data in evidence based advocacy for the improvement of living standards and tenure security in informal settlements in urban Afghanistan
profile_positions.title: Enumeration Expert
Program Manager, Local Integration of Vulnerable, Excluded & Uprooted People (LIVE-UP)

profile_positions.description:
•	Development, coordination, implementation and monitoring of projects with a focus on conflict resolution, community building, justice, politics and participatory development in urban and rural Afghanistan
•	Preparation of proposals, concept notes and business offers for clients including; UNDP, GIZ, USAID, Aga Khan Foundation, Helevetas, US Embassy, Australian Embassy, Norwegian Refugee Council
•	Monitoring & review of security conditions nationwide and analysis of operational implications
•	Design of qualitative and quantitative data collection tools
•	Qualitative & quantitative data analysis
•	Development and implementation of training curricula for national staff
profile_positions.title: Project Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Management of development projects with a focus on urban poverty alleviation, including measures to improve public health, tenure security, community resilience and urban poor settlement upgrading programs
•	Taking a leading role in the evidence based advocacy of the urban poor, independently and in cooperation with wider national and international anti-evictions campaigns
•	Design and implementation of research instruments & data collection tools to be utilized in urban poor settlements, including Participatory Urban Appraisal, Appreciative Inquiry and large scale participatory enumeration   
•	Review of Legislation and Policy for its implications on the urban poor, contributing to the discourse through the production of reports into specific issues  
•	Development of Training of Trainers (TOT) curricula for research and community mobilization activities in urban poor settlements
•	Coordination of a multidisciplinary, multicultural team
•	Capacity Building of national staff
profile_positions.title: Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Management of development projects, with a focus on environmental sustainability and improving living conditions in impoverished Dalit villages in rural Karnataka
•	Coordinating vocational education and training programs to provide livelihood opportunities for women in rural Karnataka
•	In depth qualitative and quantitative research with rural women and men to inform the design of domestic labour saving interventions 
•	Coordination of the VEDIKE 'eco-residential' school project
•	Proposal writing and fund-raising activities (both internationally and domestically within India)
•	Coordinator of 'WEBUILD 2011' volunteer construction program in Mallasandra village, rural Karnataka, including promotions, international fund raising, liaising with donors, grant application writing and management of the design and construction process
•	Coordination of an international multidisciplinary, multilingual team
